intro: Dalechampia morifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a structure called a cyathium. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Dalechampia morifolia is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
